column1: Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Crime Victimization Survey, 2016 and 2017 Public-Use Files
Authors: Rachel E. Morgan, Ph.D., and Jennifer L. Truman, Ph.D., BJS Statisticians

Note: Personal theft includes attempted or completed purse-snatching and completed pick-pocketing. It excludes attempted pick-pocketing. Pick-pocketing has historically been called pocket-picking in the NCVS. Personal theft excludes robbery, which involves the threat or use of force and is classified as a violent crime. See appendix table 7 for standard errors.
a/Rate is per 1,000 persons age 12 or older.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, National Crime Victimization Survey, 2016 and 2017 Public-Use Files.
